message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CV (Computer Vision): The paper proposes a new metric for evaluating image captioning systems that is based on a machine-learned text-image grounding model. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision sub-category. 
2. cs.CL (Computation and Language): The paper discusses the use of natural language in image captioning and the limitations of existing metrics that rely solely on text matching. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Computation and Language sub-category. 
3. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper proposes a new metric that uses a machine-learned model to evaluate image captioning systems. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Artificial Intelligence sub-category. 
4. cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper discusses the use of a machine-learned model for evaluating image captioning systems. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Machine Learning sub-category. 
5. cs.IR (Information Retrieval): The paper proposes a new metric for evaluating image captioning systems that takes into account how well machine-generated captions match human-generated captions. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Information Retrieval sub-category.
